title: Delay before I can click with spells/attack move/pings?
body:
Hi friends,

I bought a new computer today (HP Pavilion, incase its relevant) and I've noticed an odd problem. Whenever I press a key that then requires me to click the mouse button in order to activate, there's a roughly two second delay during which my clicks do nothing. A few things I've noticed this with include attack-move (A+click), pings (G+click) and spells and items (obvious...)
Just posting here to ask if anyone knows what may be causing this, and how I could fix it??

replies.body: wow exactly same problem and I posted on the boards about it
Do you have programs installed that are designed to give you 'shortcuts' by pressing a custom key combination on your keyboard?

Are you using the HP keyboard?
Have you done all windows updates?
Yes I'm using the HP keyboard. What WIndows updates are you referring to?

Any and all windows updates if you have any outstanding. 
Control panel >> System and security >> windows update
Although i more think it has some thing to do with your keyboard driver.

If you press the windows key and R at the same time it will open a run command window. 
Type in: dxdiag 
It stands for direct X diagnostics, click yes if you get a popup about checking your drivers and check out your system model, that will be the exact model of the laptop. We can use that to check your keyboard driver version on HP's website. Then update it if there is an update available or reinstall it if there is not. 

Fast way to check if it is the issue is try an external keyboard and see if you have the same problem.
